results.title: Water
results.brief_description: This film is concerned with the chemical aspects of water. Pure water mever occurs in nature, since water is the universal solvent. The percentage of water in man, in a fish, in a lettuce, and in a water lily are demonstrated. The formation of stalagtites and stalacmites in caves in limestone hills is compared with the furring of hot-water pipes and kettles, both being gradually formed deposits left behind by water. Some of the chemicals in water are needed by humans, since they are useful in building up body tissues. The film ends with a short summing up of the importance of work done by research scientists and chemists who are constantly studying the constituents of water.

results.title: Water
results.creator_credit: Dick Young, Dick Young Productions and United Nations Environment Programme
results.brief_description: Shows the importance of water in man’s existence in all parts of the world, including Africa, India and Asia. Covers social issues such as water pollution, lack of water for human consumption in the dry arid areas and the need for developing international cooperation in relation to water usage and conservation of this natural resource. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Water
results.creator_credit: Philip Stapp, Dorothy Oshlag, Columbia University Center for Mass Communications and United Nations
results.brief_description: World-wide water shortage. Today increased demands for water and increased pollutions of rivers have brought us to the verge of a world-wide water crisis. Using unusual animation techniques, this interesting film outlines the problem and stresses the need for international control and co-operation. Scans the many difficulties which surround the provision of adequate clean water to the growing world population, for agriculture, industry and health.

results.title: Water
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Water is a critical requirement for plant growth. This program examines different methods of watering commercial plants and how to measure water needs scientifically. Water moves from the roots throughout the plant, distributing nutrients and keeping the plant moist. This flow, called transpiration, is driven by diffusion, evaporation and capillary action. The plant uses osmosis to aid this process, and the importance of the Osmotic Gradient in how plants cope with drought, water-logging and salinity is discussed.

results.title: Watching them write, seeing them learn: a kindergarten writing community at work
results.creator_credit: Brian Butler and Riverina College of Advanced Education. Literacy Centre
results.brief_description: Kindergarten children experiment with written language. There are no formal writing lessons and they are left free to learn by trial and error. Narrated by Barbara Kamler.

results.title: Watch_Dogs
results.brief_description: Set in Chicago, where a central network of computers connects everyone and everything, Watch_Dogs explores the impact of technology within our society. Using the city as your weapon, you will embark on a personal mission to inflict your own brand of justice.

constellations_other.name: Freedom from surveillance
constellations_other.description: Real world and cinematic authoritarianism and resistance explored through documentaries, Hollywood blockbusters, TV and videogames.

results.description: You play as Aiden Pearce, a brilliant hacker and former thug, whose criminal past led to a violent family tragedy. While seeking justice for those events, you’ll monitor and hack those around you by manipulating the ctOS from the palm of your hand. You’ll access omnipresent security cameras, download personal information to locate a target, control traffic lights and public transportation to stop the enemy… and more.

results.title: Watch your step
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Basic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Safety”
An accident prevention film with special reference to the building industry. This film re-creates, from actual records, some of the more common accidents and points out the ways in which they could have been avoided.
